settings.name: game_version
settings.description: Select Red or Blue version.

settings.name: trainer_name
settings.description: Your trainer's name. Cannot exceed 7 characters. See the [setup guide on archipelago.gg](https://archipelago.gg/tutorial/Pokemon%20Red%20and%20Blue/setup/en) for a list of allowed characters.

values.name: choose_in_game
values.readableName: Choose in-game (you can modify the YAML manually to specify custom names)

settings.name: rival_name
settings.description: Your rival's name. Cannot exceed 7 characters. See the [setup guide on archipelago.gg](https://archipelago.gg/tutorial/Pokemon%20Red%20and%20Blue/setup/en) for a list of allowed characters.

values.name: choose_in_game
values.readableName: Choose in-game (you can modify the YAML manually to specify custom names)

settings.name: elite_four_condition
settings.description: Number of badges required to challenge the Elite Four once the Indigo Plateau has been reached. Your rival will reveal the amount needed on the first Route 22 battle (after turning in Oak's Parcel).

settings.name: victory_road_condition
settings.description: Number of badges required to reach Victory Road.

settings.name: viridian_gym_condition
settings.description: Number of badges required to enter Viridian Gym.

settings.name: cerulean_cave_condition
settings.description: Number of badges, HMs, and key items (not counting items you can lose) required to access Cerulean Cave.

settings.name: second_fossil_check_condition
settings.description: After choosing one of the fossil location items, you can obtain the remaining item from the Cinnabar Lab Scientist after reviving this number of fossils.

settings.name: badgesanity
settings.description: Shuffle gym badges into the general item pool. If turned off, badges will be shuffled across the 8 gyms.

settings.name: old_man
settings.description: With Open Viridian City, the Old Man will let you through without needing to turn in Oak's Parcel.

settings.name: randomize_pokedex
settings.description: Randomize the location of the Pokédex, or start with it. It is required to receive items from Oak's Aides.

settings.name: tea
settings.description: Adds a Tea item to the item pool which the Saffron guards require instead of the vending machine drinks. Adds a location check to the Celadon Mansion 1F, where Tea is acquired in FireRed and LeafGreen.

settings.name: extra_key_items
settings.description: Adds key items that are required to access the Rocket Hideout, Cinnabar Mansion, Safari Zone, and Power Plant. Adds four item pickups to Rock Tunnel B1F.

settings.name: extra_strength_boulders
settings.description: Adds Strength Boulders blocking the Route 11 gate, and in Route 13 (can be bypassed with Surf). This potentially increases the usefulness of Strength as well as the Bicycle.

settings.name: require_item_finder
settings.description: Require Item Finder to pick up hidden items.

settings.name: randomize_hidden_items
settings.description: Randomize hidden items. If you choose exclude, they will be randomized but will be guaranteed junk items.

values.name: exclude
values.description: Hidden items will always be junk.

settings.name: prizesanity
settings.description: Shuffles the TM prizes at the Celadon Prize Corner into the item pool.

settings.name: trainersanity
settings.description: Add a location check to every trainer in the game, which can be obtained by talking to a trainer after defeating them. Does not affect gym leaders and some scripted event battles (including all Rival, Giovanni, and Cinnabar Gym battles).

settings.name: require_pokedex
settings.description: Require the Pokédex to obtain items from Oak's Aides or from Dexsanity checks.

settings.name: all_pokemon_seen
settings.description: Start with all Pokémon "seen" in your Pokédex. This allows you to see where Pokémon can be encountered in the wild. Pokémon found by fishing or in the Cerulean Cave are not displayed.

settings.name: dexsanity
settings.description:
Adds a location check for each Pokémon flagged "Owned" on your Pokédex. If accessibility is set to `locations` and `randomize_wild_pokemon` is off, `catch_em_all` is not `all_pokemon` or `randomize_legendary_pokemon` is not `any`, accessibility will be forced to `items` instead, as not all Dexsanity locations can be guaranteed to be considered reachable in logic.

If Pokédex is required, the items for Pokémon acquired before acquiring the Pokédex can be found by talking to Professor Oak or evaluating the Pokédex via Oak's PC.

settings.name: oaks_aide_rt_2
settings.description: Number of Pokémon registered in the Pokedex required to receive the item from Oak's Aide on Route 2. *(Vanilla is 10)*

settings.name: oaks_aide_rt_11
settings.description: Number of Pokémon registered in the Pokedex required to receive the item from Oak's Aide on Route 11. *(Vanilla is 30)*

settings.name: oaks_aide_rt_15
settings.description: Number of Pokémon registered in the Pokedex required to receive the item from Oak's Aide on Route 15. *(Vanilla is 50)*

settings.name: badges_needed_for_hm_moves
settings.description: Determines whether badges are required for HM moves.

values.name: on
values.description: Badges are required for HMs as vanilla.

values.name: off
values.description: Removes the requirement for badges to use HM moves.

values.name: extra
values.description: Gives the Marsh, Volcano, and Earth Badges a random HM move to enable.

values.name: extra_plus
values.description: Gives the Marsh, Volcano, and Earth Badges a random HM move to enable, AND picks two random badges to enable a second HM move. You will only need one of the required badges to use the HM move.

settings.name: free_fly_location
settings.description: One random fly destination will be unlocked by default.

settings.name: randomize_rock_tunnel
settings.description: Randomize the layout of Rock Tunnel. *This is highly experimental.*

settings.name: blind_trainers
settings.description: Chance each frame that you are standing on a tile in a trainer's line of sight that they will fail to initiate a battle. If you move into and out of their line of sight without stopping, this chance will only trigger once.

settings.name: minimum_steps_between_encounters
settings.description: Minimum number of steps between wild Pokémon encounters.

settings.name: exp_modifier
settings.description: Modifier for EXP gained. When specifying a number, experience is multiplied by this amount and divided by 16.

settings.name: randomize_wild_pokemon
settings.description: Randomize all wild Pokémon and game corner prize Pokémon.

values.name: match_types
values.description: Select a Pokémon with at least one type matching the original type of the original Pokémon.

values.name: match_base_stats
values.description: Prefer Pokémon with closer base stat totals.

values.name: match_types_and_base_stats
values.description: Matches types and will weight towards similar base stats, but there may not be many to choose from.

settings.name: area_1_to_1_mapping
settings.description: When randomizing wild Pokémon, for each zone, all instances of a particular Pokémon will be replaced with the same Pokémon, resulting in fewer Pokémon in each area.

settings.name: randomize_starter_pokemon
settings.description: Randomize the starter Pokémon choices.

values.name: match_types
values.description: Select a Pokémon with at least one type matching the original type of the original Pokémon.

values.name: match_base_stats
values.description: Prefer Pokémon with closer base stat totals.

values.name: match_types_and_base_stats
values.description: Matches types and will weight towards similar base stats, but there may not be many to choose from.

settings.name: randomize_static_pokemon
settings.description: Randomize one-time gift and encountered Pokémon. These will always be first evolution stage Pokémon.

values.name: match_types
values.description: Select a Pokémon with at least one type matching the original type of the original Pokémon.

values.name: match_base_stats
values.description: Prefer Pokémon with closer base stat totals.

values.name: match_types_and_base_stats
values.description: Matches types and will weight towards similar base stats, but there may not be many to choose from.

settings.name: randomize_legendary_pokemon
settings.description: Randomize Legendaries. Mew has been added as an encounter at the Vermillion dock truck.

values.name: shuffle
values.description: Shuffle the legendaries with each other.

values.name: static
values.description: Shuffle Legendaries into other static Pokémon locations.

values.name: any
values.description: Allow legendaries to appear anywhere based on wild and static randomization options, and their locations will be randomized according to static Pokémon randomization options.

settings.name: catch_em_all
settings.description: Guarantee all first evolution stage Pokémon are available, or all Pokémon of all stages. Currently only has an effect if wild Pokémon are randomized.

settings.name: randomize_pokemon_stats
settings.description: Randomize base stats for each Pokémon.

values.name: shuffle
values.description: Shuffle the 5 base stat values amongst each other.

values.name: randomize
values.description: Completely randomize each stat, but will still add up to the same base stat total.

settings.name: randomize_pokemon_catch_rates
settings.description: Randomize the catch rate for each Pokémon.

settings.name: minimum_catch_rate
settings.description: Minimum catch rate for each Pokémon. If "Randomize catch rates" is on, this will be the minimum value that can be chosen. Otherwise, it will raise any Pokémon's catch rate up to this value if its normal catch rate is lower.

settings.name: randomize_trainer_parties
settings.description: Randomize enemy Pokémon encountered in trainer battles.

values.name: match_types
values.description: Select a Pokémon with at least one type matching the original type of the original Pokémon.

values.name: match_base_stats
values.description: Prefer Pokémon with closer base stat totals.

values.name: match_types_and_base_stats
values.description: Matches types and will weight towards similar base stats, but there may not be many to choose from.

settings.name: trainer_legendaries
settings.description: Allow Legendary Pokémon in randomized trainer parties.

settings.name: move_balancing
settings.description: All one-hit-KO moves and fixed-damage moves become normal damaging moves. Blizzard, and moves that cause sleep have their accuracy reduced.

settings.name: randomize_pokemon_movesets
settings.description: Randomize the moves learned by Pokémon.

values.name: prefer_types
values.description: Prefer moves that match the type of the Pokémon.

settings.name: confine_transform_to_ditto
settings.description: Regardless of moveset randomization, will keep Ditto's first move as Transform and no others will learn it. If an enemy Pokémon uses Transform before you catch it, it will permanently change to Ditto after capture.

settings.name: start_with_four_moves
settings.description: If movesets are randomized, this will give all Pokémon 4 starting moves.

settings.name: same_type_attack_bonus
settings.description: Here you can disable Same Type Attack Bonus, so that a move matching a Pokemon's type has no benefit. If disabled, all moves will gain 25% extra damage, instead of same type moves gaining 50% extra damage.

settings.name: randomize_tm_moves
settings.description: Randomize the moves taught by TMs. All TM items will be flagged as 'filler' items regardless of how good the move they teach are.

settings.name: tm_same_type_compatibility
settings.description: Chance of each TM being usable on each Pokémon whose type matches the move.

settings.name: tm_normal_type_compatibility
settings.description: Chance of each TM being usable on each Pokémon if the move is Normal type and the Pokémon is not.

settings.name: tm_other_type_compatibility
settings.description: Chance of each TM being usable on each Pokémon if the move a type other than Normal or one of the Pokémon's types.

settings.name: hm_same_type_compatibility
settings.description: Chance of each HM being usable on each Pokémon whose type matches the move. At least one Pokémon will always be able to learn the moves needed to meet your accessibility requirements.

settings.name: hm_normal_type_compatibility
settings.description: Chance of each HM being usable on each Pokémon if the move is Normal type and the Pokémon is not. At least one Pokémon will always be able to learn the moves needed to meet your accessibility requirements.

settings.name: hm_other_type_compatibility
settings.description: Chance of each HM being usable on each Pokémon if the move a type other than Normal or one of the Pokémon's types. At least one Pokémon will always be able to learn the moves needed to meet your accessibility requirements.

settings.name: inherit_tm_hm_compatibility
settings.description: If on, evolved Pokémon will inherit their pre-evolved form's TM and HM compatibilities. They will then roll the above set chances again at a 50% lower rate for all TMs and HMs their predecessor could not learn, unless the evolved form has additional or different types, then moves of those new types will be rolled at the full set chance.

settings.name: randomize_pokemon_types
settings.description: Randomize the types of each Pokémon.

values.name: follow_evolutions
values.description: Ensure Pokémon's types remain the same when evolving (except possibly gaining a type).

settings.name: secondary_type_chance
settings.description: If "Randomize Pokémon types" is on, this is the chance each Pokémon will have a secondary type. If "Follow evolutions" is selected, it is the chance a second type will be added at each evolution stage. Vanilla (-1) will give secondary types to Pokémon that normally have a secondary type.

settings.name: randomize_type_chart
settings.description: Randomize the type chart.

values.name: randomize
values.description: The matchup weight options will determine the weights. If the numbers chosen across the 4 settings add up to exactly 225, they will be the exact numbers of those matchups. Otherwise, the normal super effective, and not very effective matchup settings will be used as weights. The immunities option will always be the exact amount of immunity matchups.

values.name: chaos
values.description: The matchup settings will be ignored and every type matchup will be given a random damage modifier anywhere between 0 to 200% damage, in 10% increments.

settings.name: normal_matchups
settings.description: If 'randomize' is chosen for `randomize_type_chart`, this will be the weight for neutral matchups.

settings.name: super_effective_matchups
settings.description: If 'randomize' is chosen for `randomize_type_chart`, this will be the weight for super effective matchups.

settings.name: not_very_effective_matchups
settings.description: If 'randomize' is chosen for `randomize_type_chart`, this will be the weight for not very effective matchups.

settings.name: immunity_matchups
settings.description: If 'randomize' is chosen for `randomize_type_chart`, this will be the exact number of immunities.

settings.name: safari_zone_normal_battles
settings.description: Change the Safari Zone to have standard wild Pokémon battles.

settings.name: normalize_encounter_chances
settings.description: Each wild encounter table has 10 slots for Pokémon. Normally the chance for each being chosen ranges from 19.9% to 1.2%. Turn this on to normalize them all to 10% each.

settings.name: reusable_tms
settings.description: Makes TMs reusable, so they will not be consumed upon use.

settings.name: better_shops
settings.description: Change every town's Pokémart to contain all normal Pokémart items. Additionally, you can add the Master Ball to these shops.

settings.name: master_ball_price
settings.description: Price for Master Balls. Can only be bought if `better_shops` is set to `add_master_ball`, but this will affect the sell price regardless. Vanilla is 0

settings.name: starting_money
settings.description: The amount of money you start with.

settings.name: lose_money_on_blackout
settings.description: Lose half your money when blacking out, as in vanilla.

settings.name: trap_percentage
settings.description: Chance for each filler item to be replaced with trap items. Keep in mind that trainersanity vastly increases the number of filler items. The trap weight options will determine which traps can be chosen from and at what likelihood.

settings.name: poison_trap_weight
settings.description: Weights for Poison Traps. These apply the Poison status to all your party members.

settings.name: fire_trap_weight
settings.description: Weights for Fire Traps. These apply the Burn status to all your party members.

settings.name: paralyze_trap_weight
settings.description: Weights for Paralyze Traps. These apply the Paralyze status to all your party members.

settings.name: ice_trap_weight
settings.description: Weights for Ice Traps. These apply the Ice status to all your party members. Don't forget to buy Ice Heals!

settings.name: randomize_pokemon_palettes
settings.description: Modify palettes of Pokémon.

values.name: primary_type
values.description: Set Pokémon's palettes based on their primary type.

values.name: follow_evolutions
values.description: Randomize palettes, but palettes will remain the same through evolutions (except Eeveelutions).

values.name: completely_random
values.description: Randomize all Pokémon's palettes individually.
